column1: 2 ^ Dīxit injūstus ut dēlinquat in sēmet ipsō; nōn est timor Deī ante oculōs ejus. ^ The unjust hath declared within himself that he might sin; there is no fear of God before his eyes.
3 ^ Quoniam dolōsē ēgit in conspectū ejus
column2: ut inveniātur inīquitās ejus ad odium. ^ For in his sight he hath done deceitfully
column3: that his iniquity may be found unto hatred.

column1: 4 ^ Verba ōris ejus inīquitās et dolus; nōluit intellegere ut bene ageret. ^ The words of his mouth are iniquity and guile; he has not wished to understand that he might do well.
5 ^ Inīquitātem meditātus est in cubīlī suō; astitit omnī viae nōn bonae
column2: malitiam autem nōn ōdīvit. ^ He hath devised iniquity on his bed; he hath set himself on every way that is not good
column3: but evil he hath not hated.
et vēritās tua usque ad nūbēs. ^ O Lord
column5: and thy truth reacheth even to the clouds.

column1: 7 ^ Jūstitia tua sīcut montēs Deī; jūdicia tua abissus multa. Hominēs et jūmenta salvābis
column2: Domine. ^ Thy justice is as the mountains of God; thy judgments are a great deep. Men and beasts thou wilt preserve
Deus. Fīliī autem hominum in tegmine ālārum tuārum spērābunt. ^ How hast thou multiplied thy mercy
column3: O God! But the children of men shall put their trust under the cover of thy wings.

column2: et torrente voluptātis tuae pōtābis eōs. ^ They shall be inebriated with the plenty of thy house
column3: and thou shalt make them drink of the torrent of thy pleasure.

column1: 10 ^ Quoniam apud tē est fons vītae
column2: et in lūmine tuō vidēbimus lūmen. ^ For with thee is the fountain of life
column3: and in thy light we shall see light.

column2: et jūstitiam tuam hīs quī rēctō sunt corde. ^ Extend thy mercy to them that know thee
column3: and thy justice to them that are right in heart.

column2: et manus peccātōris nōn moveat mē. ^ Let not the foot of pride come to me
column3: and let not the hand of the sinner move me.

column1: 13 ^ Ibī cecidērunt quī operantur inīquitātem; expulsī sunt
column2: nec potuērunt stāre. ^ There the workers of iniquity are fallen
